frequencyOnCheckpointScanInfo: When face verification is set to random, "Less often" and "Very often" settings determine the frequency on which the mobile application will request face verification for a checkpoint scan.
frequencyOnCheckpointScanInfoSecondLine: "Very often" option means that face verification will be requested randomly every maximum 4 scans, whereas "Less often" means that it will be requested randomly every maximum 9 scans.

attentionWO:
"Needs attention" gives an indication to the manager that there might be something wrong with a WO.
A WO can be marked as needing attention if the Operational Need cannot be covered, in case it was "Rejected" or "Aborted" by the Assignees.

looseNote:
By default, Schedules are Strict, meaning each Checkpoint has its own specific Check Time Range.
If you select the 'Loose' option, you can set the same Check Time Range for all Checkpoints in the Schedule.
